text: Vanmeekanathar Temple, Tiruneipperu is a Siva temple in Tiruvarur district in Tamil Nadu (India). This place is also known as Adiyar Temple. It is at distance of 8 km in Tiruvarur-Thiruthuraipoondi Roadபு.மா.ஜெயசெந்தில்நாதன், தேவார வைப்புத்தலங்கள், வர்த்தமானன் பதிப்பகம், சென்னை, 2009 The temple can be reached just opposite to Nami Nandi Adigal temple. ==Vaippu Sthalam== It is one of the shrines of the Vaippu Sthalams sung by Tamil Saivite Nayanar Appar. This place is also known as Emapperur.மூவர் தேவார வைப்புத்தலங்கள், EmappErUr, Appar, 6-70-3Shiva Temples, தேவார வைப்புத்தலங்கள், ஏமப்பேரூர், Appar, 6-70-3 ==Presiding deity== The presiding deity in the garbhagriha, represented by the lingam, is known as Vanmeekanathar. His consort is known as Umaparameswari. This was the birthplace of Nami Nandi Adigal. ==Shrines== In the Prakaram shrines of Vinayaka, Subramania, Bairava, Sanisvara and Surya are found. In the front mandapa the shrine of the goddess is found. ==Kumbhabhishekham== The Kumbhabhishekham of the temple was held on 30 March 2018.தினமணி, வெள்ளிமணி, நிகழ்வுகள், 30 மார்ச் 2018 ==References== Category:Shiva temples in Tiruvarur district
title: Vanmeekanathar Temple, Tiruneipperu
